qas.question: What does child labour deprive children of?
Are child artists an exception to the laws with regards to child labour?

answers.text: exceptions include work by child artists

qas.question: Is work done by Amish children an exception?

answers.text: work such as those by Amish children

qas.question: Where is there legislation that prohibits child labour?
Is all work done by children considered to be child labour?

answers.text: These laws do not consider all work by children as child labour

context: Child labour refers to the employment of children in any work that <a0_0>deprives children of their childhood<a0_0/>, interferes with their ability to attend regular school, and that is mentally, physically, socially or morally dangerous and harmful. This practice is considered exploitative by many international organisations. <a3_0>Legislation across the world<a3_0/> prohibit child labour. <a4_0>These laws do not consider all work by children as child labour<a4_0/>; <a1_0>exceptions include work by child artists<a1_0/>, family duties, supervised training, certain categories of <a2_0>work such as those by Amish children<a2_0/>, some forms of child work common among indigenous American children, and others.
